intro: Orophea laui, commonly known as the Laui’s starling tree, is a tropical plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its striking, palmately lobed leaves. The plant produces showy, yellow-orange flowers that are often clustered in inflorescences, attracting various pollinators. Orophea laui is typically found in humid, shaded forest environments, where it thrives in the understory. Its unique morphology and ecological role make it an important species in the biodiversity of Madagascar’s flora.
